Attachment

Adding the attachment class to an elemeent creates a context in which layout classes (row-item, chunk, list) use half of their default spacing.

In foundation, an "attachment" is a piece of content in the feed attached to a parent item (ie. a reply or event meta info).

Ancestry only affects spacing in attachment. Text sizing remains explicit.

Event meta info example

13

Monday Jan 13, 6:30 pm

Backpacking For Beginners

<div class="row attachment">
    <div class="row-item row-item--shrink">
        <time class="tearsheet" datetime="2017-01-13">13</time>
    </div>
    <div class="row-item">
        <h4 class="text--caption">Monday Jan 13, 6:30 pm</h4>
        <h4>Backpacking For Beginners</h4>
    </div>
</div>

Discussion reply example

Member Name

This is a reply to a post. I'm going to keep writing until the line wraps. Has it wrapped yet? Who cares.

<div class="row attachment">
    <div class="row-item row-item--shrink">
        <a href="#" class="avatar avatar--person avatar--small" style="background-image: url(http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/member/9/1/8/4/thumb_141217252.jpeg);"></a>
    </div>
    <div class="row-item text--small">
        <h4 class="text--bold display--inline">Member Name</h4>
        <p class="display--inline">This is a reply to a post. I'm going to keep writing until the line wraps. Has it wrapped yet? Who cares.</p>
    </div>
</div>

    </li>
    <li>
        <a href="#" class="avatar avatar--person avatar--small" style="background-image: url(http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/member/9/1/8/4/thumb_141217252.jpeg);">Member Name</a>
    </li>

    </li>

    <li>
        <a href="#" class="avatar avatar--person">

        </a>

        </a>
    </li>

            <abbr title="Jake Levine" class="avatar-initial">J</abbr>
        </a>
    </li>
    <li>
        <a href="#" class="avatar avatar--person avatar--org">
            <abbr title="Jake Levine" class="avatar-initial">J</abbr>
        </a>
    </li>
</ul>

Avatar variants

A base class of avatar is required. The following classes are optional variants:

Class Description
avatar--small Adjusts avatar size to the smallest media size
avatar--big Adjusts avatar size to the biggest media size
avatar--person Variant for people
avatar--org Variant for organizers
avatar--fbFriend Variant for facebook friends
avatar--icon For icons in avatars (might move this in a later version)

Buttons

Example

Button Primary Button Button with right Icon X X Primary button with left Icon Borderless Button Contrast Button Small Button Full width button ヘ(◕。◕ヘ) Full width primary button with left Icon 
<a class="button" href="#">Button</a>
<a class="button button--primary" href="#">Primary Button</a>
<a class="button button--icon" href="#">
    <span class="button-label">Button with right Icon</span>
    <span class="button-icon">X</span>
</a>
<a class="button button--icon button--primary" href="#">
    <span class="button-icon">X</span>
    <span class="button-label">Primary button with left Icon</span>
</a>
<a class="button button--borderless" href="#">Borderless Button</a>
<a class="button button--primary button--contrast" href="#">Contrast Button</a>
<a class="button button--small" href="#">Small Button</a>
<a class="button button--bordered button--fullWidth" href="#">Full width button</a>
<a class="button button--primary button--icon button--fullWidth" href="#">
    <span class="button-icon">ヘ(◕。◕ヘ)</span>
    <span class="button-label">Full width primary button with left Icon</span>
</a>

Button variants

A class of .button is required for buttons. The following classes are optional variants:

Class Description
.button--primary rounded button with dark background; for primary actions
.button--contrast bold, dark text; use on dark backgrounds or photos (ie. top nav bar)
.button--bordered rounded bordered button
.button--borderless borderless button
.button--small decreases size of button
.button--icon button with icon

Collapsible

Collapses elements using class toggling. A base class of collapsible is required.

To collapse the element, add the collapsible--close class.

Toggle

I'm collapsible content

Adding a class of `collapsible--close` to this `section` will set max height to 0vh

<a id="cTrigger" class="button button--primary chunk followLink">Toggle</a>

<section class="stripe collapsible" id="cContainer">
    <div class="bounds collapsible-content">
        <h2>I'm collapsible content</h2>
        <p>Adding a class of `collapsible--close` to this `section` will set max height to 0vh</p>
    </div>
</section>

Floating Action

If a page has a single important action, you can use a floatingAction wrapper to call it out. At small screen sizes, the element with the floatingAction class will fix to the bottom of the viewport.

Note: A class of hasFloatingAction is available if extra space is needed at the bottom of a page for the floating action to "land" in. Apply to the body tag.

The button below will fix to the bottom of the viewport at small sizes

Floating Action 
<div class="bounds">
        <p class="chunk">The button below will fix to the bottom of the viewport at small sizes</p>
        <div class="floatingAction">
            <a href="#" class="floatingAction-content button button--primary button--fullWidth">Floating Action</a>
        </div>
    </div>

Menu

Context menu style dropdoowns. Actions are delivered in-document next to the menu toggle as a non-js fallback. When a client is javascript-enabled, the menu is hidden and posisitioned fixed (assumes this style of menu will only be found within a view-head).

Toggling of menu visibility is handled with javascript (supporting js for documentation TK).

NOTE: This visual example currently shows the non-js fallback only. Use as a guide for markup.

(icon)
  • Select All
  • Select None 
<div class="menu">
    <a class="menu-toggle" href="#">(icon)</a>

    <ul class="menu-actions">
        <li class="menu-actions-item">
            <a href="#">Select All</a>
        </li>
        <li class="menu-actions-item">
            <a href="#">Select None</a>
        </li>
    </ul>
</div>

Tabs

  • Tab One
  • Tab Two
  • Tab Three
<nav>
    <ul class="tabs">
        <li class="tabs-tab"><a href="#">Tab One</a></li>
        <li class="tabs-tab tabs-tab--selected"><a href="#">Tab Two</a></li>
        <li class="tabs-tab"><a href="#">Tab Three</a></li>
    </ul>
</nav>

Tabs (parent) variants

A class of tabs is required. The following classes are optional variants:

Class Description
tabs--full Makes tabs span the full width of their parent element

Tab (child) variants

A class of tabs-tab is required for tabs. The following classes are optional variants:

Class Description
tabs-tab--selected Applies styles for tab selected state

RSVP Tags

Status tags for RSVP.

Going
Not going
Waiting
<div class="rsvpTag rsvpTag--yes">Going</div>
<div class="rsvpTag rsvpTag--no">Not going</div>
<div class="rsvpTag rsvpTag--waiting">Waiting</div>

Variants

A class of rsvpTag is required. Variant classes:

Class Description
rsvpTag--yes indicates "yes" RSVP status
rsvpTag--no indicates "no" RSVP status
rsvpTag--waiting indicates waitlist RSVP status

Tearsheet

Standard display for dates.

Tearsheet example

13
<div class="tearsheet">13</div>

Tearsheet with date detail

13

Tomorrow at 7:00 PM

<div class="dateTime">
    <div class="dateTime-tearsheet">13</div>
    <p class="dateTime-detail">Tomorrow at 7:00 PM</p>
</div>

Toggle Pills

Checkbox form elements styled as toggle buttons.

"unchecked" state

<div class="toggleButton">
    <input class="toggleButton-input" type="checkbox" name="topic-dining" id="topic-dining" value="ToggleBtn" />
    <label class="toggleButton-label" for="topic-dining">Dining Out</label>
</div>

"checked" state

<div class="toggleButton">
    <input checked class="toggleButton-input" type="checkbox" name="topic-hiking" id="topic-hiking" value="ToggleBtn" />
    <label class="toggleButton-label" for="topic-hiking">Hiking</label>
</div>

Cards

Card-like boxes.

Standard, Group, and Event cards

(This example uses gridList, but cards may placed anywhere)

  • Look at this card

    Just look at it

  • Some Meetup Group Name

    457 [chapter.who]

  • Béchamel Hell: French Cuisine for Survivalists Meetup

    457 [chapter.who]

  • I'm an event card

<section class="stripe--collection">
    <div class="bounds">
        <ul class="gridList gridList--has1 atMedium_gridList--has3">

            <!-- Base card styles -->
            <li>
                <div class="card">
                    <h4>Look at this card</h4>
                    <p>Just <em>look at it</em></p>
                </div>
            </li>

            <!-- Group card -->
            <li>
                <div class="card card--group inverted" style="background-image: url(http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/7/6/f/8/600_434010456.jpeg);">
                    <div class="card--group-content">
                        <h4 class="text--bold">Some Meetup Group Name</h4>
                        <p>457 [chapter.who]</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <!-- Group card with long name -->
            <li>
                <div class="card card--group inverted" style="background-image: url(http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/7/6/f/8/600_434010456.jpeg);">
                    <div class="card--group-content">
                        <h4 class="text--bold">Béchamel Hell: French Cuisine for Survivalists Meetup</h4>
                        <p>457 [chapter.who]</p>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </li>

            <!-- Event card -->
            <li>
                <div class="card card--event">
                    <h4>I'm an event card</h4>
                </div>
            </li>
        </ul>
    </div>
</section>
